column4: hi some of you know how can i fix this: http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/breezy/universe/binary-i386/Packages.gz: El subproceso gzip devolvi un cdigo de error (1)
run your apt-get again
with which parameter?
the same way you ran it before
the servers are under a heavy load, and you may not have d/l a complete file
I use synaptic. I think I have problems with my sources.list. I dont know which are the correct repositories
i doubt its your sources, this is a common problem when a file doesnt download properly
so I have to run apt-get update???
yes try that
in your .bashrc
and if I, for example, want to run some app that uses java, is it going to work editing that file?? I mean if I do ALT+F2 and I write javac after I have edited, the command is not recognized
you'll have to "source /home/username/.bashrc" after you edit it
ok
thanks!
but how can I for example make my $PATH to aid to another directories? I mean I have already source .bashrc and I cant yet do ALT+F2 and get java recognized :(
put java in your $PATH
offcourse i have edited the .bashrc and wrote export $PATH:/opt/j2sdk1.5/bin and napa, nothing happens when I try to run that command (java) from application launcher (ALT+F2). Sorry for my ignorance
yes it is
yes it is possible if the machine you want to log into has a ssh server running and you have an account on it
text based...in a console
yes, see my original answer
so the command is ssh?
see the debian new maintainers guide at debian.org
ok ok. thanks
